meanings.definition: The act or process of decrepitating.
meanings.sent1: The decrepitation of the old book echoed in the quiet room.
meanings.sent2: The decrepitation of the leaves underfoot signaled the arrival of autumn.
meanings.sent3: As the toy robot underwent decrepitation, it seemed to come alive with crackling energy.
meanings.sent4: The decrepitation of the campfire filled the night with a symphony of crackling notes.
meanings.sent5: The decrepitation of the ancient parchment added a sense of history to the library.

meanings.definition: The crackling or popping sound made by something decrepitating.
meanings.sent1: The decrepitation of the firewood brought warmth to the chilly cabin.
meanings.sent2: The decrepitation of the old floorboards added character to the historic house.
meanings.sent3: The decrepitation of the popcorn in the microwave was music to their ears.
meanings.sent4: The decrepitation of the vinyl record filled the room with nostalgic crackling.
meanings.sent5: The decrepitation of the autumn leaves created a soothing natural symphony.
